title: Neural Disk Scheduler
summary: An AI-driven I/O request optimizer that learns access patterns to predictively schedule disk operations and reduce latency.
architecture: A 3-layer modeling framework that ingests I/O traces, processes them via a recurrent neural network, and outputs an optimized request queue. A C++ kernel module interface applies the schedule.
responsibilities: Designed the neural network architecture, implemented the training pipeline, and co-developed the kernel interface.

title: Modular Data Pipeline Framework
summary: A declarative framework for building, deploying, and managing resilient data pipelines with configurable processing stages.
architecture: Pipelines are defined as YAML files and translated into a network of gRPC microservices orchestrated by Kubernetes. A central controller manages state and recovery.
responsibilities: Led the design of the declarative API, built the gRPC service scaffolding, and implemented the Kubernetes controller.
